page.title: 04 Manning Watts House
page.content:
There are 23 pleasantly kept bungalows occupied by mainly single people over the required age of 65. The homes are built in a crescent around the Health Centre which operates as a Social Centre too.
The people are cared for by a Warden who makes daily visits. She is a qualified nurse, helping with surgeries held twice weekly. She keeps the necessary drugs, entering details about illnesses etc. in a log book. She can always be relied upon to accompany visits to hospital or relatives.
Her daughter, acting as Relief Warden, collects pensions and shopping.
